intro: Alsine macrocarpa lusus rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid-stemmed alsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its erect, rigid stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. It is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed areas. Alsine macrocarpa lusus rigidifolia is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
